steps.description: Hold power button and volume down button together for 10-15 seconds
steps.warning: Button combination may vary by device model

steps.description: Try different charging cable and wall adapter that you know work
Gently clean charging port with dry toothbrush to remove lint/debris
steps.warning: Be very gentle to avoid damaging charging pins

steps.description: Let device charge undisturbed for at least 30 minutes before trying to turn on
Ensure device is completely powered off while charging

wont_turn_on.when_to_stop: If device still won't respond after charging
wont_turn_on.professional_help_needed: May need battery replacement or charging port repair

steps.description: Go to Settings > Battery to see which apps are using most power
Turn on Low Power Mode (iOS) or Battery Saver (Android)
Lower screen brightness or enable auto-brightness
Close apps running in background that you're not using
Disable GPS/location for apps that don't need it
steps.warning: Some apps may not function properly without location access

steps.description: Turn off unnecessary push notifications for apps

battery_drains_quickly.when_to_stop: If battery life doesn't improve after 2-3 days
battery_drains_quickly.professional_help_needed: Battery may need replacement, especially if device is 2+ years old

steps.description: Use a different charging cable that you know works with another device
Use a different power adapter/wall charger
steps.warning: Ensure adapter matches your device's power requirements

steps.description: Try plugging into a different wall outlet
Use dry toothbrush, compressed air, or plastic pick to remove debris
steps.warning: Never use metal objects or liquids in charging port

steps.description: If your device supports wireless charging, test with wireless charger
Power off device completely, then turn back on and try charging

wont_charge.when_to_stop: If device still won't charge with known good cable and adapter
wont_charge.professional_help_needed: Charging port may need replacement or battery may be faulty

steps.description: Discontinue use to prevent cuts from glass shards
If screen still responds, immediately back up important data
steps.warning: Screen may stop working completely at any time

steps.description: Place clear tape over cracks to hold glass together
steps.warning: This is temporary only - do not continue regular use

steps.description: Don't press on cracked areas or bend the device
steps.warning: Pressure can worsen cracks and damage internal components

cracked_screen.when_to_stop: Do not attempt DIY screen repair
cracked_screen.professional_help_needed: Professional screen replacement required - bring to repair shop immediately

steps.description: Close the app completely and restart it
Power off device completely, wait 30 seconds, then turn back on
Check app store for updates to the problematic app
Go to Settings > Apps > [App Name] > Storage > Clear Cache
steps.warning: This will log you out of the app

steps.description: Delete unnecessary photos, videos, or apps to free up storage
Check for and install system updates
steps.warning: Ensure device is charged and connected to Wi-Fi

app_crashes.when_to_stop: If apps continue crashing after these steps
app_crashes.professional_help_needed: May need factory reset or hardware diagnostic
